channel.title: Patch has become corrupt
channel.description:
After creating my first patching and fiddling around with it, i decided to close it and then reopen it later. I then got this message... And my patch is lost. No biggie, but I still spend a couple of hours on it. Can it be restored somehow?
Javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException: ParseError at [row,col]:[109,10] Message: XML document structures must start and end within the same entity. javax.xml.stream.XMLStreamException: ParseError at [row,col]:[109,10] Message: XML document structures must start and end within the same entity. at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.impl.XMLStreamReaderImpl.next(XMLStreamReaderImpl.java:596) at item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @the19thbear Troels Jørgensen
item.description:
@the19thbear wrote:

Thanks a lot. This community and this box is so cool! not near the axoloti now so can't do any repatching:)

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

thetechnobear:

I'll look into a fix, to stop the error being displays... but as i say, this is not the driod you are looking for.

fixed, in development

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

the19thbear:

On the VCA patch/patcher parent module, click "edit object definition".

patcher/patch... you should use the edit button on the front panel.
you cannot edit it as an object.
(its inlets/outlets/params are defined in the sub-patch)

in the next version, you will be able to convert it to an object, but frankly this is not really what you want

I'll look into a fix, to stop the error being displays... but as i say, this is not the driod you are looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

Anyway, did you try copying content to new patcher object and deleting old?

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

Nono. It is not working in 1.06. It works in 1.09.

I guess it is not same issue we had then. I just encountered many times that if I edit the content of a patcher object, the patch doesnt compile. And this is on 1.06!

It works in 1.09.

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @the19thbear Troels Jørgensen
item.description:
@the19thbear wrote:

Using the newest version. 9. Silly me. I hadn't seen that it was a pre release. I'll use 06 instead!

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

WHich version of Axoloti are you using? 1.06?

Try copying all of the content of the patcher into a new patcher object and delete the old patcher object. Then it should work again.

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @the19thbear Troels Jørgensen
item.description:
@the19thbear wrote:

Ok. Here is another patch. Its not corrupt, but has problems. I cant relocate the buttons on VCA Patch/Patcher and the other patch/patcher modules. Try this:
On the VCA patch/patcher parent module, click "edit object definition". THen rigth away inthe axoloti status thingy, i get tons of red writing about java.
Kraut_0.5.axp (46.7 KB)

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @the19thbear Troels Jørgensen
item.description:
@the19thbear wrote:

Will do:) And thanks again

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

ok, if there is a 'next time', think about what you last did (so might be the cause) , and post the 'corrupted' file.

unfortunately, saying a file is corrupt, and giving me the error, unfortunately does not given me enough info to chase it further.

as of 1.0.9, I know of two possible ways to get in this state (see the 1.0.9 thread) , both of which I've fixed in development for the next release. but there is no way of knowing, if this was your case or not....

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @the19thbear Troels Jørgensen
item.description:
@the19thbear wrote:

Thanks for looking into it. I ended up rebuilding it though. I had learned some new things since then so its also better organised now. But thanks anyway!

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @thetechnobear Mark Harris
item.description:
@thetechnobear wrote:

Post the patch file.
which version of Axoloti ?
Can you reproduce the issue ?

The issue is the patch file will probably tell us what's wrong but unlikely how it got into that state.

Edit, also the patch file is text , so potentially it can be edited , to recover at least most of its contents.

Read full topic

item.title: Patch has become corrupt
item.dc:creator: @the19thbear Troels Jørgensen
item.description:
@the19thbear wrote:

After creating my first patching and fiddling around with it, i decided to close it and then reopen it later. I then got this message... And my patch is lost. No biggie, but I still spend a couple of hours on it. Can it be restored somehow?
